section.p: The vendor specific attribute (VSA) provides more details on the call processing. When VSA is enabled in NCC application preferences, an additional attribute (vsa) is dumped for Gx (CCR-i and CCA-i only) CDRs.
Use the application preference in the following table to enable VSA parameter in CDR.

row.entry: Flag to enable or disable VSA CDR.

fig.codeblock: ------------------------------------- CDR length: 300 Release ID | Version ID: 7|2 Data record format | TS number: 1|7 Release identifier extension: 0 Name Tag Data RecordType 0 POLICY_RECORD Event 1 gx_cca_create RecordTimestamp 1 17/09/2018 05:35:55 session_id 1 session1 application 1 GX command_type 1 gx_cca_create localtimestamp 1 17/09/2018 11:05:55 resultCode 1 2001 vsa 1 PCRF-Error-Detail#Test123 previous_rules 1 applied_rules 1
